<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
ENVIRONMENT
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/08/un-issues-warning-food-production?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
UN: Eyes Bigger Than Your Stomach?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="UN: Eyes Bigger Than Your Stomach?" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1Mjk4Nzk0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On Thursday, the UN published the fruit of two years’ work by 107 scientists from around the world. It’s yet another alarming report on human contributions to climate change, but this time, your literal food’s on the menu. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">“Multi-breadbasket failure”</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Agriculture, forestry, and other land uses are causing 23% of global greenhouse gas emissions. Soil holds carbon, so as we degrade natural land, its ability to store carbon decreases.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">A co-author of the report <a href="https://apnews.com/afb6990efd7c437da19c6d4d9976899c?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">told the AP</a> “the threat of climate change affecting people’s food on their dinner table is increasing,” and chances of “multi-breadbasket failure” are rising. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Food is getting more expensive, crop yields are declining, and nutrient and protein levels are decreasing. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nearly 30% of food is lost or wasted (accounting for as much as 10% of greenhouse gas emissions), while over 820 million people are undernourished.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>If consumption patterns continue, we’ll need additional tracts of land close to the size of two Indias </span><span><a href="https://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2019/08/08/748416223/to-slow-global-warming-u-n-warns-agriculture-must-change?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">to feed</a></span><span> the projected 9.8 billion residents of 2050. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The report stressed the need for immediate and substantial action, and that businesses are stakeholders as much as governments, consumers, local communities, and land managers. It says they need flexible strategies, strong ties with the public sector, and to sort out their priorities. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">We can stop a lot of it. </strong>We “just” need…</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Better agricultural processes (like no-tilling farming and improved targeted fertilizer application)</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Plant-based diets with less red meat</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Reforestation</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>More biofuel development</span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Let’s talk solutions</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In the private sector, we’re seeing more innovation around food production. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">NJ-based AeroFarms <a href="https://www.ft.com/content/cac48190-9d8a-11e9-9c06-a4640c9feebb?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">raised</a> $100 million last month to expand its indoor, vertical farm warehouses. Solar Foods is readying a 2021 <a href="https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2019/08/nasas-idea-for-making-food-from-thin-air-just-became-a-reality-it-could-feed-billions/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launch</a> for a high-protein and -carb ingredient made entirely out of CO2, water, and electricity. And don’t forget Giant Leap Week favorite <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/cellular-agriculture-a-giant-leap-for-food/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">cellular agriculture</a> technology. Startups are already producing cell-for-cell copies of meat products and trying to scale so you can afford them.</p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TECH
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/08/uber-loses-5-2-billion?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Uber Lost How Much?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Uber Lost How Much?" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1Mjk4MTk3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Flickr, <a href="http://www.quotecatalog.com," class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Quote Catalog,</a> <a href="https://www.flickr.com/photos/stockcatalog/40834812504" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">uber</a>, (<a href="https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/" class="link" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">CC BY 2.0</a>)</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When you get your air conditioning bill this month, just remember: Uber said it lost more than $5.2 billion last quarter. Posting your biggest quarterly loss ever = not the most enjoyable way to start an earnings call. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yes, about $3.9 billion of that gigantic loss can be <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/08/technology/uber-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">chalked up</a> to stock-based compensation related to its May IPO. But the remaining $1.3 billion is still almost double what it lost a year ago. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Plus, Uber (-5.63% after hours) revenue increased 14% year over year, its slowest quarterly growth ever. Nowhere is the company’s transition from hypergrowth → hypogrowth more evident than in Latin America, where revenue <a href="https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-posts-its-largest-ever-quarterly-loss-11565295373?mod=hp_lead_pos1&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">fell 24%</a> from last year. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">You know what? It’s a Friday in August...let’s talk about some positives. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">Gross bookings rose 31% to $15.8 billion,</strong></span><span> showing there’s </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-08/uber-posts-5-2-billion-quarterly-loss-sales-miss-estimates?srnd=premium&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">still demand</a></span><span> for its core ride-hailing and food delivery services.</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>
</span><span><strong style="color:#000">The price war with competitors is nearing a ceasefire.</strong></span><span> For you, that means fewer “80% off your next 1,000 rides” notifications. But for Lyft and Uber, it means the winding down of a bruising battle over market share. “We’re definitely seeing the competitive environment improve,” CEO Dara Khosrowshahi said.</span>
</li>
</ol>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
CONSUMER GOODS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/08/no-accounting-kraft-heinz-s-continued-slump?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
No Accounting for Kraft Heinz’s Continued Slump
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Oprah says we all need to practice gratitude. Today, yours can be that you aren’t an exec at Kraft Heinz, which <a href="https://www.apnews.com/7ae108d40c237a4d8a7534893ceab673?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">reported</a> delayed Q2 earnings yesterday. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The gory details:</strong> In Q2, Kraft Heinz...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Took a </span><span><a href="https://marketrealist.com/2019/08/kraft-heinz-compounds-berkshires-problems/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">54.6% hit</a></span><span> in operating income</span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Pulled earnings and sales guidance, pushing shares (-8.58%) down a staircase to all-time lows</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory:</strong> Ever slipped on the sidewalk during a downpour after a root canal? That’s what <a href="https://www.nytimes.com/2019/02/21/business/kraft-heinz-earnings.html?module=inline&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Kraft Heinz’s February</a> was like. The company...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Took a $15.4 billion writedown</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Missed profit estimates</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Revealed an SEC subpoena over its accounting practices</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">On yesterday’s call, Kraft Heinz attributed over $1 billion in charges to “perceived risk” about the company's valuation. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>new CEO Miguel Patricio, formerly of AB InBev, said on the earnings call that his turnaround plan <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/business/kraft-heinz-hadnt-hit-bottom-after-all/2019/08/08/c49d7caa-b9fe-11e9-8e83-4e6687e99814_story.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">will focus</a> on measures such as high-end products, following P&G’s model. </p>

<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
TRAVEL
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/08/tripadvisor-reviews-holy-sites-may-inflated-according-researchers?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Spiritual Experience: Five Stars
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="No Alt" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjQ1LzEyMDBweC10aGVfa2FhYmFfZHVyaW5nX2hhampfanBnLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im9zbG8tcHJvZHVjdGlvbiIsImVkaXRzIjp7InJlc2l6ZSI6eyJ3aWR0aCI6MTAwMCwiaGVpZ2h0IjpudWxsfX19">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Adli Wahid, The Kaaba during Hajj, CC BY-SA 4.0</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Over 1.8 million pilgrims <a href="http://www.arabnews.com/node/1537126/saudi-arabia?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arrived</a> in Mecca, Saudi Arabia, for the annual Hajj, a journey to the holy city that is part of many Muslims’ religious practice. And just like travelers everywhere, they probably used online reviews to prepare and figure out the logistics. But those reviews may not be reliable. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Two professors, Tom van Laer of the University of Sydney and Elif Izberk-Bilgin of the University of Michigan, published <a href="https://www.tandfonline.com/doi/full/10.1080/0267257X.2018.1550434?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a paper</a> last December that showed reviews of sacred places like Mecca’s Grand Mosque, India’s Ganga Aarti, and Jerusalem’s Church of the Holy Sepulchre get unusually high ratings online. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When we say “unusually high,” we mean...</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Mecca’s sites </span><span><a href="https://theconversation.com/everything-in-mecca-gets-5-stars-and-online-reviews-of-other-holy-sites-are-wildly-inflated-too-119614?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">averaged</a></span><span> a near-perfect 4.96 stars out of 5 on TripAdvisor, compared to an average of 3.96 for Europe’s 200 highest-rated destinations. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The combined average for what the authors call “spiritual places” on TripAdvisor was 4.63 stars. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The $ quote: </strong>“Our work shows that ratings for pilgrimage sites reflect the spiritual only, which risks an overly positive interpretation of the material.”</p>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
QUIZ
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/08/08/brew-s-weekly-news-quiz-august-9?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Here's Looking at You, Quiz
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Less feral than hogs. Closer to downtown than San Diego International Airport. V pumped for National Lazy Day tomorrow. It’s the Brew’s Weekly News Quiz. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">1. You knew this was coming. <strong style="color:#000">What does HSBC stand for? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">2. <strong style="color:#000">Fill in the blank: </strong>_________ consumption is declining dramatically while alternatives like water are on the rise. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">3. Already in 2019, Disney broke the record for highest-grossing year for a studio ever. <strong style="color:#000">Which studio did it pass to become No. 1? </strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">4. With all the talk of a currency war, we have to ask: <strong style="color:#000">What is the name of China’s currency?</strong> </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">5. Last weekend, French entrepreneur Franky Zapata rode a hoverboard he designed across <strong style="color:#000">which body of water? </strong>For 35 points of extra credit, was this question just a ploy to bring back the GIF from Monday? </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><img src="https://media.giphy.com/media/h5czHBlEvxyYBZLsYv/giphy.gif" class="img-responsive" width="540" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 540px;" alt=""></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>Giphy</em></sup></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em><strong style="color:#000">Answers:</strong> 1) The Hongkong and Shanghai Banking Corporation Limited 2) U.S. dairy milk 3) Disney 4) Yuan, but we’ll also accept renminbi 5) English Channel, extra credit: no </em></sup></p>

width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1Mjk4Nzk0LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eOn Thursday, the UN published the fruit of two years’ work by 107 scientists from around the world. It’s yet another alarming report on human contributions to climate change, but this time, your literal food’s on the menu. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003e“Multi-breadbasket failure”\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eAgriculture, forestry, and other land uses are causing 23% of global greenhouse gas emissions. Soil holds carbon, so as we degrade natural land, its ability to store carbon decreases.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eA co-author of the report \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/afb6990efd7c437da19c6d4d9976899c?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etold the AP\u003c/a\u003e “the threat of climate change affecting people’s food on their dinner table is increasing,” and chances of “multi-breadbasket failure” are rising. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFood is getting more expensive, crop yields are declining, and nutrient and protein levels are decreasing. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNearly 30% of food is lost or wasted (accounting for as much as 10% of greenhouse gas emissions), while over 820 million people are undernourished.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eIf consumption patterns continue, we’ll need additional tracts of land close to the size of two Indias \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.npr.org/sections/thesalt/2019/08/08/748416223/to-slow-global-warming-u-n-warns-agriculture-must-change?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eto feed\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e the projected 9.8 billion residents of 2050. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe report stressed the need for immediate and substantial action, and that businesses are stakeholders as much as governments, consumers, local communities, and land managers. It says they need flexible strategies, strong ties with the public sector, and to sort out their priorities. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eWe can stop a lot of it. \u003c/strong\u003eWe “just” need…\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eBetter agricultural processes (like no-tilling farming and improved targeted fertilizer application)\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePlant-based diets with less red meat\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eReforestation\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eMore biofuel development\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eLet’s talk solutions\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn the private sector, we’re seeing more innovation around food production. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNJ-based AeroFarms \u003ca href=\"https://www.ft.com/content/cac48190-9d8a-11e9-9c06-a4640c9feebb?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eraised\u003c/a\u003e $100 million last month to expand its indoor, vertical farm warehouses. Solar Foods is readying a 2021 \u003ca href=\"https://www.weforum.org/agenda/2019/08/nasas-idea-for-making-food-from-thin-air-just-became-a-reality-it-could-feed-billions/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunch\u003c/a\u003e for a high-protein and -carb ingredient made entirely out of CO2, water, and electricity. And don’t forget Giant Leap Week favorite \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/stories/cellular-agriculture-a-giant-leap-for-food/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ecellular agriculture\u003c/a\u003e technology. Startups are already producing cell-for-cell copies of meat products and trying to scale so you can afford them.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F08%2F08%2Fun-issues-warning-food-production\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTY1Mjk4MTk3LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFlickr, \u003ca href=\"http://www.quotecatalog.com,\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eQuote Catalog,\u003c/a\u003e \u003ca href=\"https://www.flickr.com/photos/stockcatalog/40834812504\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003euber\u003c/a\u003e, (\u003ca href=\"https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/2.0/\" class=\"link\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCC BY 2.0\u003c/a\u003e)\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen you get your air conditioning bill this month, just remember: Uber said it lost more than $5.2 billion last quarter. Posting your biggest quarterly loss ever = not the most enjoyable way to start an earnings call. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYes, about $3.9 billion of that gigantic loss can be \u003ca href=\"https://www.nytimes.com/2019/08/08/technology/uber-earnings.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003echalked up\u003c/a\u003e to stock-based compensation related to its May IPO. But the remaining $1.3 billion is still almost double what it lost a year ago. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003ePlus, Uber (-5.63% after hours) revenue increased 14% year over year, its slowest quarterly growth ever. Nowhere is the company’s transition from hypergrowth → hypogrowth more evident than in Latin America, where revenue \u003ca href=\"https://www.wsj.com/articles/uber-posts-its-largest-ever-quarterly-loss-11565295373?mod=hp_lead_pos1\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efell 24%\u003c/a\u003e from last year. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYou know what? It’s a Friday in August...let’s talk about some positives. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003col\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eGross bookings rose 31% to $15.8 billion,\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e showing there’s \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-08-08/uber-posts-5-2-billion-quarterly-loss-sales-miss-estimates?srnd=premium\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003estill demand\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e for its core ride-hailing and food delivery services.\u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003e\n\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe price war with competitors is nearing a ceasefire.\u003c/strong\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e For you, that means fewer “80% off your next 1,000 rides” notifications. But for Lyft and Uber, it means the winding down of a bruising battle over market share. “We’re definitely seeing the competitive environment improve,” CEO Dara Khosrowshahi
